examples.translation: He/she flayed the skin from the dead sheep.

etymology:
Inherited from Ottoman Turkish یوزمك (yüzmek, “to skin, flay”), from Proto-Turkic *yüŕ- (“to peel off (skin), to skin”).
Compare Mongolian зорох (zorox, “to plane, shave, chip”).
Cognate with Karakhanid [script needed] (yüzmēk, “to skin”).
